title.narrative: PAPE IR9.3: CHILD RIGHTS AND YOUTH

description.narrative: PAPE Programme Component Results (PCR) 9 IR9.3: By 2017, national child rights coordination and reporting mechanisms strengthened guided by national child and youth policies, with increased participation of young people., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Economic And Social Policy General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Human Rights Institutions, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: PAPE Programme Component Results (PCR) 9: Social policies, safety nets and budgets progressively address disparities and build resilience for the realization of child rights.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: PAPE PCR 9 IR9.3: By 2017, national child rights coordination and reporting mechanisms strengthened guided by national child andyouth policies, with increased participation of young people.

description.narrative: Ten of 13 Pacific Island Countries are now on track with Convention on the Rights of the Child reporting. Significant progress was made in Tonga, Federated States of Micronesia and Kiribati to clear the outstanding reports, which are behind schedule by 20, 17, and six years, respectively. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) National coordinating mechanism responsible for overseeing the implementation treaty body recommendations on child rights is in place

baseline.value: 12 operational (3 with regular and 9 with occasional meetings)
